The claim was made by the Young Conserva: a group that endorsed Ryan Sitton's opponent in a primary runoff.
The claim was based on a press release b: stating that Sitton's company, PinnacleAIS, accepted over $650,000 in Obama stimulus dollars.
The claim was supported by a web post by: which indicated that PinnacleAIS was awarded a Small Business Administration loan of $652,000 in 2009.
However: Sitton's campaign manager and PinnacleAIS's chief financial officer stated that the web posts were inaccurate and that the company ultimately closed a conventional bank loan instead of the Small Business Administration loan.
